title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Social and Community Service Managers

content.rendered:
What is a Social and Community Service Manager?

Social and Community Service Managers are in charge of bringing together community members and funders to have conversations surrounding the community and events/programs that would help out positively.

Where does a Social and Community Service Manager work?

  • Government
  • Nonprofits
  • Social service companies

How much does a Social and Community Service Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Social and Community Service Manager is $41,069.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Social and Community Service Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Social work majors
  • Business administration majors
  • Public health majors
Search Social and Community Service Manager job opportunities on Handshake.

Social and Community Service Manager skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Social and Community Service Managers succeed in their work:

  • Strong communication skills
  • Attention to detail for data analysis
  • Strong writing skills for creating drafts and proposals

What are some common questions about Social and Community Service Managers?

Q: What is social service management?

A: Social service management is concerned with the effectiveness and efficiency of providing the public with what is needed.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Social and Community Manager.
